Title: Linux-PAM: Authentication bypass
Synopsis:
A vulnerability has been found in Linux-PAM, allowing attackers to
    bypass the authentication process.

Background.Text: Linux-PAM (Pluggable Authentication Modules) is an architecture allowing the separation of the development of privilege granting software from the development of secure and appropriate authentication schemes.

Description.Text: A flaw was found in Linux-Pam in the way it handle empty passwords for non-existing users.

Impact.Text: A remote attacker, who only needs to know a non-existing username, could bypass security restrictions and authenticate as root user.

Workaround.Text: Ensure that root account is protected by a non-empty password.
